subject: Marketing
title: Commitment and Consistency
description: A short lesson to help you apply Commitment and Consistency.

hook.text: Homeowners who placed a tiny safe-driving sticker agreed to a huge lawn sign two weeks later.

buildup.text: Those without the sticker said no four times more often.

discovery.text: Once we commit to something small, we feel pressure to stay consistent with that identity.

twist.text: Marketers use this with free trials, small pledges, and yes-ladders that build momentum.

climax.text: The initial commitment reshapes how you see yourself. Future choices follow.

punchline.text: Small yeses lead to big ones.

quiz.question: Why did homeowners with a sticker agree to a larger sign?
options: They felt pressure to stay consistent with their earlier commitment
They were paid more for the larger sign
They didn't notice how big the sign was
